image.altText: Anthony Albanese morning media after budget

props.synopsis: The prime minister is poised to call a May 3 election, triggering a five-week campaign to convince voters whether Labor or the Coalition under Peter Dutton is most fit to lead the country.

title.children: Albanese to call May 3 federal election on Friday morning

image.altText: A giant flame roars from gas flare stack, silhouetted against the dusk sky

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton vows to "immediately" force gas giants to set aside for domestic use as much as 20 per cent of supply that would "otherwise be exported", cutting wholesale prices by 40 per cent.

title.children: Dutton promises lower energy prices with plan to tap gas exports

image.altText: Peter Dutton smiles during QT.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton has delivered his response to the government's budget and it's big on petrol and gas, with barely a word on nuclear.

title.children: Will PM Dutton raise the petrol price in his first budget? That's tomorrow's problem

image.altText: A graphic showing Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton with bowser pumps, in front of a background of hundred dollar bills.

props.synopsis: A policy fight over cost-of-living relief has emerged with a federal election looming. Labor and the Coalition have both promised to ease hip pocket pain, but voters will be asked to choose between income tax cuts or cheaper petrol.

title.children: Compare the pair: Which major parties' tax policy leaves you better off?

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holds his arms out while speaking in question time

props.synopsis: You need only look to question time to see who Labor thinks could be in danger at the election Anthony Albanese is about to call.

title.children: Marginal MPs thrown a bone, Albo goes full Gen Z and a bill Leo couldn’t save

image.altText: Donald Trump frowns.

props.synopsis: This week's story about Washington's group chat mix-up has prompted debate over what constitutes "war plans" and whether the material was classified. The Atlantic has now published the full chat.

title.children: What we learned when Washington's war group chat was published in full

image.altText: Jade Gresham celebrates a goal for the Bombers.

props.synopsis: Trailing at the final change, the Bombers finish over the top of the Power to claim a thrilling two-goal victory, their first of the season. Follow live.

title.children: Bombers answer critics with come-from-behind win over Power

image.altText: Noah Balta, wearing a black gurnsey with yellow sash, celebrates next to the goal post

props.synopsis: Police prosecutors say AFL footballer Noah Balta should be jailed over a brutal assault they argue could have killed his 27-year-old victim.

title.children: Police seek jail for AFL star after brutal assault aired in court

image.altText: Isaah Yeo puts his hands on his hips as he and the Penrith Panthers stand under the posts after conceding a try in an NRL game.

props.synopsis: The Penrith Panthers lose three straight games for the first time since 2019, unable to overcome a 28-0 half-time deficit against the South Sydney Rabbitohs.

title.children: 'Comical' first half costs Penrith as Souths hand them third straight loss

image.altText: The outside of the Nine Entertainment headquarters in North Sydney.

props.synopsis: The data of 16,000 readers of the Sydney Morning Herald, The Age and The Financial Review is exposed online following a major cyber security breach

title.children: Nine newspapers subscribers have data exposed online in breach

image.altText: A whole, halved and sliced Shepard avocado, one variety commonly available in Australia.

props.synopsis: Hass avocados are out of season for the next few months, meaning those craving an avo fix may have to turn to the often-maligned Shepard variety. But despite the bad rap, Shepard avocados have their own strengths.

title.children: Shepard avocados get a 'bad rap'. Here’s how to enjoy them

props.synopsis: Text messages between two of the four people charged with the murder of Cassius Turvey appear to show one of them admitting lying to police about the murder of the teenager, the WA Supreme Court hears.

title.children: 'My life's ruined': Cassius Turvey murder accused's texts shown to court

image.altText: A woman with a wound on her elbow.

props.synopsis: The Buruli ulcer, a bacterial infection that eats away at skin tissue, affected more than 350 people in Victoria last year. Now there's a new case in NSW.

title.children: Fourth case of flesh-eating ulcer in NSW has health experts concerned

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with toys.

props.synopsis: Documents reveal dozens of childcare centres operated by ASX-listed giant G8 Education have exposed children to serious safety risks, including toxic chemicals, children going missing and disturbing cases of alleged sexual assaults.

title.children: Document dump exposes disturbing incidents in childcare centres

image.altText: Liam Lawson of New Zealand and Red Bull looking down, running hand through his hair

props.synopsis: Kiwi Formula 1 racer Liam Lawson's stint as a Red Bull driver has come to a screeching halt, axed from the team after just two grands prix.

title.children: Kiwi racer axed by Red Bull after two F1 races

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A woman with sunglasses on outside court next to a camera operator

props.synopsis: A diabetic woman accused of murdering her elderly parents, by injecting them with her own insulin, suffered undue hardship while in jail for breaching her bail.

title.children: Woman accused of murdering parents spared breach of bail conviction

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin smiles

props.synopsis: The Russian President reportedly wants Ukraine to cede territory his troops have never occupied as part of negotiations taking place to end the war, which continues to rage despite multiple summits.

title.children: Putin's 'crazy' ceasefire demands involve taking land beyond front lines

image.altText: Kim Jong Un stands with back to camera as a drone flies off in the distance.

props.synopsis: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has supervised the test of suicide drones with artificial intelligence technology, according to state media.

title.children: North Korea tests AI suicide drone as Kim Jong Un looks on, says state media

image.altText: Donald Trump shows a signed document in the Oval Office at the White House

props.synopsis: The White House expects the tariffs will raise $US100 billion in revenue annually and foster more domestic manufacturing.

title.children: Donald Trump announces new 25 per cent tariffs on imported vehicles

image.altText: A pair of prosthetic legs stand alone on a beach.

props.synopsis: Every surfer at this Byron Bay event has a different story to tell. But they all agree on one thing — the healing power of the ocean.

title.children: Josh lost limbs after stepping on a fish hook. Then he found surfing

image.altText: Hundreds of Palestinians protesting on the streets in Gaza with banners and signs

props.synopsis: The rare protests follow Israel's resumption of attacks on Gaza following a nearly two-month ceasefire.

title.children: 'We want to stop the killing': Why Gazans are protesting against Hamas

image.altText: A blonde man in his 40s wearing a blue suit and tie walking in front of a road in Adelaide

props.synopsis: The former SA opposition leader pleaded guilty to two counts of supplying or administering a drug that wasn't cannabis to another person.

title.children: Former SA opposition leader David Speirs pleads guilty to drug charges

image.altText: A crowd of men and women wearing traditional bridal attire all shout in unison

props.synopsis: The Unification Church has had close ties to world politics for decades, but a court ruling in Japan could be the end of the organisation.

title.children: A church with links to Trump, coups and Soviet Union leaders faces dissolution

image.altText: Police stand next to a damaged vehicle.

props.synopsis: A speeding driver responsible for a deadly crash north of Brisbane 18 months ago has pleaded guilty to causing the death of a 72-year-old woman.

title.children: Speeding driver pleads guilty to dangerous driving after killing woman

image.altText: The torso and arms of a boy infected with measles showing a rash on his skin.

props.synopsis: Western Australia could be on track for its worst outbreak of measles in the past five years, as infections in Hakea Prison cause chaos in the courts and the list of exposure sites grows.

title.children: WA measles outbreak worsens amid fears of vaccine hesitancy

image.altText: A sign that reads Parliament House on the right, with the NT parliament house behind and an Aboriginal flag displayed.

props.synopsis: The NT's sacred sites authority says the "rapid timeframe" and "limited nature" of proposed amendments to the NT Sacred Sites Act "raises many questions about why this is happening".

title.children: Warning 'rushed' changes to NT sacred site laws risk 'unintended consequences'

image.altText: a stage with triple j banners and fireworks going off as a crowd watches

props.synopsis: The triple j One Night Stand is back for 2025, bringing one regional town an incredible night of live music this May.

title.children: Why triple j chose this small town for their biggest concert of the year

image.altText: A dozen fall army worm specimens on a laboratory agar plate showing signs of a white fungus which killed them.

props.synopsis: The insect said to threaten the food security of 600 million people globally may have met its match in the form of several native Australian fungi and bacteria.

title.children: Killing an unkillable pest insect made possible with Australian fungi

image.altText: Protestors rallied on a green lawn with signs

props.synopsis: New environment laws rushed through parliament have ended almost 18 months of uncertainty for west coast Tasmanian salmon workers. Environmental groups say "all possible avenues" are being explored to challenge the laws.

title.children: Salmon industry relieved, but environment group says 'war not over'

image.altText: helicopter pilot, wet desert in background.

props.synopsis: A 66-year-old airlifted to Birdsville after five days trapped by floodwaters that threatened to sweep away his vehicle says he's had the adventure of a lifetime.

title.children: Outback drive turns into 'real adventure' for stranded lone traveller

image.altText: CCTV footage of a store alight

props.synopsis: Successive governments have increased the tax on cigarettes and tobacco to drive down smoking rates — but having helped with one problem, it has contributed to another.

title.children: Smokers have been pushed onto the black market. There's no easy way back

image.altText: A sheep looks at camera through a fence. Many other sheep crammed near them.

props.synopsis: Farmers label the findings of a state government inquiry into the impact of the live sheep export ban on NSW as a disappointment, with just one recommendation delivered.

title.children: Inquiry into live sheep export impact branded a disappointment by farmers

image.altText: Three images side by side, showing Chris Hemsworth, Vanessa Kirby, and Anthony Mackie on the red carpet looking into the camera

props.synopsis: The mammoth cast of Avengers: Doomsday includes longtime Marvel mainstays such as Robert Downey Jr and Chris Hemsworth as well as new entrants and stars from Fox's original X-Men movies, including Patrick Stewart and Ian McKellan.

title.children: Marvel announces Avengers: Doomsday cast featuring new stars and old legends
